name: 9.23 "Carla Loves Clavin" Online Trivia | 'Cheers'- Season 9 | 10 Questions

questions.text: How much did Norm charge to paint Sam's office?
questions.explanation:
400 beers.

	Rebecca thought it was $400. Norm told her that beer was his own special currency.

questions.correct: They eliminated the looks part of the contest.
options: He didn't think Cheers was fit to hold the contest.
They eliminated the brains part of the contest.
He thought Carla was too ugly to be in the contest.
questions.explanation:
They eliminated the looks part of the contest.

	The Boston Bar Maid contest was going to be held at Cheers that year, but that's not why Sam was upset. Carla said that every year the winner was always the woman with the "biggest honeydews".

questions.text: What did the winner of the contest get?
questions.explanation:
New Mazda car.

	Carla at first had no intention of joining the contest. However, when she heard what the prize was she changed her mind.

questions.text: What did the button Carla wore have printed on it?
questions.correct: My name is Carla, and I love your smile.
options: My name is Carla, how may I help you?"
My name is Carla, how may I serve you?
My name is Carla, and you're awesome.
questions.explanation:
My name is Carla, and I love your smile.

	She said she also had one that said she would go all the way to win. Sam told her, "Stick to this smile thing".

questions.text: Who did Carla think was a judge?
questions.explanation:
Cliff Clavin.

	When she found out Cliff was a judge she broke her tray over her head. Woody wondered who Frank Smith (one of the other judges) was and why Carla was so upset he was a judge.

questions.text: Why did Carla say she pushed someone off the barstool?
options: She was tapping him on the shoulder.
It was an attempt at a hug gone wrong.
questions.explanation:
It was an affectionate nudge.

	Earlier in the episode, she pushed Cliff off his stool. She told him, "it was nothing personal. I was just letting off steam." However, because she believed Cliff to be a judge, she was kissing up to him big time.

questions.text: What was the name of the hog that Woody tried to win with back in Hanover?
questions.explanation:
Maribel.

	Woody said he lost because he didn't kiss up to the judges. When asked how Maribel was, he replied, "Not bad with applesauce."

questions.text: What did Carla wash her hands with?
questions.explanation:
kerosene.

	She was upset and disgusted that she touched Cliff's feet. When Sam told her she washed them enough, she told him, "get a match".

questions.text: Why did Carla do so well at the contest?
questions.correct: She used her anger toward Cliff to do her best in the contest.
options: She's just  a really good bar maid.
She figured either kill Cliff or win a contest and she didn't want to go to jail.
She knew that if she didn't win, she'd never get the brand new car.
questions.explanation:
She used her anger toward Cliff to do her best in the contest.

	She told Cliff she was going to kill him after the contest.  Cliff thought it was well worth it because she rubbed his bare feet.

No.

	The winner of the contest spilled all the drinks. However, the judges picked her because of her looks.
